summary: Van Gogh-inspired book management web app with authentication, user dashboard, and landing page
architectural_notes: Landing page serves as entry point with Van Gogh painting background
Internet Identity integration for Sign Up/Log In on landing page
Light/Dark mode preference stored in browser localStorage
Logout clears frontend session and redirects to landing page
Delete Account removes all backend data (favorites, books, reviews, reading lists, analytics) before redirect
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Full-screen Van Gogh painting for landing page background, artistic and welcoming style (landing-hero.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Create a new Van Gogh-inspired landing page component at frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx with full-screen Van Gogh painting background, Sign Up and Log In buttons integrated with Internet Identity, and a light/dark mode toggle
Update routing in frontend/src/App.tsx to make the new LandingPage the default route for unauthenticated users, and redirect authenticated users to /home
Implement theme persistence using browser localStorage to store and retrieve the user's light/dark mode preference across sessions
Update the Log Out button in frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx to redirect to the landing page with a smooth fade transition after clearing frontend session data
Update the Delete Account flow in frontend/src/pages/AuthorDashboardPage.tsx to redirect to the landing page with a smooth fade transition after successful account deletion
Ensure the Delete Account modal in frontend/src/components/DeleteAccountModal.tsx has a semi-transparent overlay with blurred/tinted background for readability

new_feature_requests.summary: Van Gogh-inspired landing page with Sign Up/Log In and theme toggle
Post-action redirects for logout and account deletion to landing page
Theme persistence via localStorage across sessions
Delete account flow with backend data removal
Verify that the backend deleteAccount function in backend/main.mo properly removes all user data including profile, books, reviews/ratings, reading lists, and analytics when called
